intro: Verbesina brachypoda, commonly known as the shortleaf beggar-tick, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes and stream banks. It features hairy stems and leaves with a distinctive, rough texture. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer and attract various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
